intro: Rhanterium, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often forming a rounded shape. Rhanterium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
